s0021.chinese: 公劉雖在戎狄之間，復修后稷之業，務耕種，行地宜，自漆、沮度渭，取材用，行者有資，居者有畜積，民賴其慶。
s0021.literal: Although Gong Liu was among the Rong and Di barbarians, he revived Houji's work, devoted himself to farming and planting, practiced what was suitable for the land, from Qi and Ju crossed the Wei, took timber for use, travelers had provisions, residents had stores, the people relied on his good fortune.

s0022.chinese: 百姓懷之，多徙而保歸焉。
s0022.literal: The common people cherished him, many migrated and sought protection in returning to him.

s0023.chinese: 周道之興自此始，故詩人歌樂思其德。
s0023.literal: The rise of the Zhou way began from this, therefore poets sang and delighted in thinking of his virtue.

s0024.chinese: 公劉卒，子慶節立，國於豳。
s0024.literal: Gong Liu died, his son Qing Jie ascended, established the state at Bin.

s0025.literal: Qing Jie died, his son Huang Pu ascended.

s0026.literal: Huang Pu died, his son Cha Fu ascended.

s0027.literal: Cha Fu died, his son Hou Zhu ascended.

s0028.literal: Hou Zhu died, his son Gong Bo ascended.

s0029.literal: Gong Bo died, his son Tai Wang ascended.

s0030.literal: Tai Wang had sons Tai Bo, Yu Zhong, and Ji Li.

s0031.literal: Ya Yu died, his son Gong Shu Zu Lei ascended.

s0032.chinese: 公叔祖類卒，子古公亶父立。
s0032.literal: Gong Shu Zu Lei died, his son Gu Gong Dan Fu ascended.

s0033.chinese: 古公亶父復修后稷、公劉之業，積德行義，國人皆戴之。
s0033.literal: Gu Gong Dan Fu revived the work of Houji and Gong Liu, accumulated virtue and practiced righteousness, all the people of the state revered him.

s0034.chinese: 薰育戎狄攻之，欲得財物，予之。
s0034.literal: The Xun Yu Rong and Di attacked him, desiring to obtain wealth and goods, he gave them to them.

s0035.literal: Afterward they attacked again, desiring to obtain land and people.

s0036.literal: The people were all angry and wished to fight.

s0037.chinese: 古公曰：「有民立君，將以利之。
s0037.literal: Gu Gong said: 'The ruler's way is to benefit the people. Though I die, why begrudge it? I will not fight.'

s0038.chinese: 今戎狄所為攻戰，以吾地與民。
s0038.literal: He prepared to move. The people all wished to follow the ruler.

s0039.chinese: 民之在我，與其在彼，何異。
s0039.literal: Gu Gong said: 'Those who reveal my plans will die.'

s0040.chinese: 民欲以我故戰，殺人父子而君之，予不忍為。」
s0040.literal: He secretly ordered his sons: 'When I leave, you must follow me quickly.'

s0041.chinese: 乃與私屬遂去豳，度漆、沮，踰梁山，止於岐下。
s0041.literal: The next day he left, and the people followed him saying: 'We will die with our ruler.'

s0042.chinese: 豳人舉國扶老攜弱，盡復歸古公於岐下。
s0042.literal: Gu Gong feared the Rong and Di would pursue and harm the people, so he stopped and said: 'You love me, but I cannot bear to harm you.'

s0043.chinese: 及他旁國聞古公仁，亦多歸之。
s0043.literal: He separated 300 li of land to give to the Rong and Di, and moved to Qi.

s0044.chinese: 於是古公乃貶戎狄之俗，而營筑城郭室屋，而邑別居之。
s0044.literal: Therefore, the ancient Duke abandoned the customs of the Rong and Di barbarians, and built walled cities, houses, and rooms, separating the people into distinct settlements.

s0045.literal: He made Tai Bo and Yu Zhong cede the throne to Ji Li.

s0046.literal: Tai Bo and Yu Zhong agreed and went to Wu and Yue, tattooed and cut their hair, and became foreigners.

s0047.chinese: 古公有長子曰太伯，次曰虞仲。
s0047.literal: The people of Wu and Yue heard of Tai Bo's virtue and all came to him.

s0048.chinese: 太姜生少子季歷，季歷娶太任，皆賢婦人，生昌，有聖瑞。
s0048.literal: Ji Li inherited the throne as King Wen.

s0049.chinese: 古公曰：「我世當有興者，其在昌乎？」
s0049.literal: King Wen was diligent in government and loved the people.

s0050.chinese: 長子太伯、虞仲知古公欲立季歷以傳昌，乃二人亡如荊蠻，文身斷髪，以讓季歷。
s0050.literal: He sought out worthies and sages, and the Duke of Zhou and others came to him.

s0051.chinese: 古公卒，季歷立，是為公季。
s0051.literal: Gu Gong died, Ji Li ascended, this was Gong Ji.

s0052.chinese: 公季修古公遺道，篤於行義，諸侯順之。
s0052.literal: Gong Ji followed Gu Gong's legacy, was devoted to practicing righteousness, the lords submitted to him.

s0053.chinese: 公季卒，子昌立，是為西伯。
s0053.literal: Gong Ji died, his son Chang ascended, this was Xi Bo.

s0054.chinese: 西伯曰文王，遵后稷、公劉之業，則古公、公季之法，篤仁，敬老，慈少。
s0054.literal: Xi Bo was called King Wen, followed the work of Houji and Gong Liu, observed the laws of Gu Gong and Gong Ji, was profoundly benevolent, respected the elderly, loved the young.

s0055.chinese: 禮下賢者，日中不暇食以待士，士以此多歸之。
s0055.literal: He treated worthies with courtesy, at noon had no time to eat while waiting for scholars, scholars therefore came to him in great numbers.

s0056.chinese: 伯夷、叔齊在孤竹，聞西伯善養老，盍往歸之。
s0056.literal: Bo Yi and Shu Qi were in Gu Zhu, heard Xi Bo was good at caring for the elderly, and came to join him.

s0057.chinese: 太顛、閎夭、散宜生、鬻子、辛甲大夫之徒皆往歸之。
s0057.literal: Taidian, Hongyao, San Yisheng, Yuzi, and Xiahou Dafu and others came to him.

s0058.chinese: 崇侯虎譖西伯於殷紂曰：「西伯積善累德，諸侯皆向之，將不利於帝。」
s0058.literal: When King Wen was imprisoned at Youli, he increased in strength, the lords many came to Xi Bo.

s0059.literal: When King Wen was released from prison, the Shang king gave him the right to punish without asking permission.

s0060.literal: Hongyao and others were troubled by this.

s0061.chinese: 乃求有莘氏美女，驪戎之文馬，有熊九駟，他奇怪物，因殷嬖臣費仲而獻之紂。
s0061.literal: King Wen said: 'My ancestor Houji founded our clan. I should restore the title of Houji.'

s0062.chinese: 紂大說，曰：「此一物足以釋西伯，況其多乎！」
s0062.literal: He went to inspect the descendants of Houji and found Wu Wang.

s0063.chinese: 乃赦西伯，賜之弓矢斧鉞，使西伯得征伐。
s0063.literal: Wu Wang was worthy, King Wen made him Houji.

s0064.literal: King Wen died, his son Fa ascended, this was King Wu.

s0065.chinese: 西伯乃獻洛西之地，以請紂去炮格之刑。
s0065.literal: King Wu was diligent and wise, the people were at peace.

s0066.literal: King Wu married the daughter of the ruler of Yu, gave birth to King Cheng.

s0067.chinese: 西伯陰行善，諸侯皆來決平。
s0067.literal: King Wu made the Duke of Zhou and others his ministers.

s0068.chinese: 於是虞、芮之人有獄不能決，乃如周。
s0068.literal: King Wu died, King Cheng was young, the Duke of Zhou acted as regent.

s0069.chinese: 入界，耕者皆讓畔，民俗皆讓長。
s0069.literal: The Duke of Zhou was devoted to his duties, King Cheng was pleased.

s0070.chinese: 虞、芮之人未見西伯，皆慚，相謂曰：「吾所爭，周人所恥，何往為，秖取辱耳。」
s0070.literal: The Duke of Zhou made the Shao Proclamation, and the people were at peace.

s0071.literal: King Cheng grew up, the Duke of Zhou returned power to him.

s0072.chinese: 諸侯聞之，曰「西伯蓋受命之君」。
s0072.literal: King Cheng was diligent in government, the world was at peace.

s0073.literal: King Cheng died, his son Kang Wang ascended.

s0074.literal: Kang Wang monitored the eastern regions, toured the lords, administered justice, the nation was at peace.

s0075.literal: Forty more years without punishment, the world was at peace under Kang Wang.

s0076.chinese: 殷之祖伊聞之，懼，以告帝紂。
s0076.literal: The Shang ancestor Yi heard of this and was afraid, reported it to Emperor Zhou.

s0077.literal: Zhou said: 'Is there not the Heavenly Mandate?

s0080.literal: The next year, attacked Chong Hou Hu.

s0081.chinese: 而作豐邑，自岐下而徙都豐。
s0081.literal: He built Feng city, moved the capital from Qi below the mountain to Feng.

s0082.chinese: 明年，西伯崩，太子發立，是為武王。
s0082.literal: The next year, defeated the Qi state.

s0083.literal: King Wen died, King Wu ascended.

s0084.chinese: 其囚羑里，蓋益易之八卦為六十四卦。
s0084.literal: King Wu made the Duke of Zhou prime minister, and the Duke of Shao assistant.

s0085.chinese: 詩人道西伯，蓋受命之年稱王而斷虞芮之訟。
s0085.literal: He prepared troops, observed the stars and constellations, chose an auspicious day.

s0086.literal: King Wu reviewed the troops at Mengjin.

s0087.literal: The Shang king Zhou heard of this and laughed, saying: 'The western barbarians are few.'

s0088.chinese: 追尊古公為太王，公季為王季：蓋王瑞自太王興。

s0089.chinese: 武王即位，太公望為師，周公旦為輔，召公、畢公之徒左右王，師修文王緒業。
s0089.literal: King Wu crossed the Yellow River at Mengjin with 800 lords.

s0090.literal: The next day, engaged in battle at Muye.

s0091.literal: The Shang troops were numerous, but the Zhou troops were resolute.

s0092.chinese: 為文王木主，載以車，中軍。
s0092.literal: The Shang troops all turned against Zhou, and Zhou was defeated.

s0093.chinese: 武王自稱太子發，言奉文王以伐，不敢自專。
s0093.literal: King Wu entered the Shang capital, the city of Zhao.

s0094.chinese: 乃告司馬、司徒、司空、諸節：「齊栗，信哉！
s0094.literal: He captured the treasures of the Yin Shang, returned to Fenghao.

s0095.chinese: 予無知，以先祖有德臣，小子受先功，畢立賞罰，以定其功。」
s0095.literal: He divided the lands, enfeoffed the Zhou lords.

s0096.literal: He put the Duke of Zhou in charge of the eastern regions.

s0097.chinese: 師尚父號曰：「總爾眾庶，與爾舟楫，後至者斬。」
s0097.literal: King Wu died, King Cheng was young, the Duke of Zhou acted as regent.

s0098.chinese: 武王渡河，中流，白魚躍入王舟中，武王俯取以祭。
s0098.literal: The three guards rebelled, the Duke of Zhou put down the rebellion.

s0099.chinese: 既渡，有火自上復于下，至于王屋，流為烏，其色赤，其聲魄云。
s0099.literal: He moved the Yin people to Luo, established the eastern capital.

s0100.chinese: 是時，諸侯不期而會盟津者八百諸侯。
s0100.literal: He made the Luo Proclamation, established the well-field system.

s0101.literal: He made the various lords swear oaths.

s0102.chinese: 武王曰：「女未知天命，未可也。」
s0102.literal: King Cheng grew up, the Duke of Zhou returned the government.

s0103.literal: King Cheng went to the eastern capital, toured the lords.

s0104.chinese: 居二年，聞紂昏亂暴虐滋甚，殺王子比干，囚箕子。
s0104.literal: The lords all came to court, no one dared to be late.

s0105.chinese: 太師疵、少師彊抱其樂器而奔周。
s0105.literal: King Cheng returned to Fenghao, was diligent in government.

s0106.chinese: 於是武王遍告諸侯曰：「殷有重罪，不可以不畢伐。」
s0106.literal: Therefore King Wu announced to all the lords: 'Yin has grave crimes, we cannot but completely attack them.'

s0107.chinese: 乃遵文王，遂率戎車三百乘，虎賁三千人，甲士四萬五千人，以東伐紂。
s0107.literal: He followed King Wen, and led 300 war chariots, 3,000 tiger warriors, 45,000 armored soldiers, to attack Zhou eastward.

s0108.chinese: 十一年十二月戊午，師畢渡盟津，諸侯咸會。
s0108.literal: In the eleventh year, twelfth month, day wuwu, the army all crossed Mengjin, all the lords assembled.

s0110.chinese: 武王乃作太誓，告于眾庶：「今殷王紂乃用其婦人之言，自絕于天，毀壞其三正，離逖其王父母弟，乃斷棄其先祖之樂，乃為淫聲，用變亂正聲，怡說婦人。
s0110.literal: King Wu made the Great Oath, announced to the multitudes: 'Now the Yin king Zhou uses the words of his women, cuts himself off from Heaven, destroys his three officials, separates from his royal parents and brothers, discards his ancestors' music, makes licentious sounds, uses them to change and confuse proper sounds, delights in women.'

s0111.literal: Therefore now I Fa will jointly execute Heaven's punishment.

s0112.chinese: 勉哉夫子，不可再，不可三！」
s0112.literal: Strive, gentlemen, it cannot be done twice, cannot be done three times!'

s0114.chinese: 二月甲子昧爽，武王朝至于商郊牧野，乃誓。
s0114.literal: In the second month, day jiazi at dawn, King Wu arrived at the Shang suburb of Muye, and made the oath.

s0115.chinese: 武王左杖黃鉞，右秉白旄，以麾。
s0115.literal: King Wu held the yellow axe in his left hand, white banner in his right, to command.

s0116.literal: He said: 'Distant are the people of the western lands!'

s0118.chinese: 我有國冢君，司徒、司馬、司空，亞旅、師氏，千夫長、百夫長，及庸、蜀、羌、髳、微、纑、彭、濮人，稱爾戈，比爾干，立爾矛，予其誓。」
s0118.literal: I have the great lords of states, the Minister of Works, Minister of War, Minister of the Masses, subordinate officers, commanders, captains of a thousand, captains of a hundred, and the people of Yong, Shu, Qiang, Mao, Wei, Lu, Peng, and Pu. Raise your spears, array your shields, set your lances, I will make my oath.'

s0119.chinese: 王曰：「古人有言『牝雞無晨。
s0119.literal: The king said: 'The ancients had a saying: 'The hen does not crow at dawn.

s0120.literal: If the hen crows at dawn, it brings ruin to the family.'

s0121.chinese: 今殷王紂維婦人言是用，自棄其先祖肆祀不答，昏棄其家國，遺其王父母弟不用，乃維四方之多罪逋逃是崇是長，是信是使，俾暴虐于百姓，以姦軌于商國。
s0121.literal: Now the Yin king Zhou only uses the words of women, abandons his ancestors' generous sacrifices without response, carelessly abandons his state and family, neglects his royal parents and brothers without employing them, but honors and promotes the many criminals and fugitives from the four directions, trusts and employs them, causing violence and oppression to the common people, bringing chaos and rebellion to the Shang state.'

s0122.literal: Now I Fa will jointly execute Heaven's punishment.

s0123.chinese: 今日之事，不過六步七步，乃止齊焉，夫子勉哉！
s0123.literal: Today the battle must be decisive, we will not return until evening.'

s0124.chinese: 不過於四伐五伐六伐七伐，乃止齊焉，勉哉夫子！
s0124.literal: In the second month, day jiazi, the Zhou army defeated the Yin at Muye.

s0125.chinese: 尚桓桓，如虎如羆，如豺如離，于商郊，不御克奔，以役西土，勉哉夫子！
s0125.literal: King Zhou fled, burned himself in the Deer Tower.

s0126.chinese: 爾所不勉，其于爾身有戮。」
s0126.literal: King Wu cut off his head, hung it on a white banner.

s0127.chinese: 誓已，諸侯兵會者車四千乘，陳師牧野。
s0127.literal: He attacked Yan, killed Bi Gan the loyal minister, released Mi Zi, restored Jizi.

s0128.chinese: 帝紂聞武王來，亦發兵七十萬人距武王。
s0128.literal: He divided the Yin lands, enfeoffed the Zhou lords.

s0129.chinese: 武王使師尚父與百夫致師，以大卒馳帝紂師。
s0129.literal: He returned to Fenghao, the four directions all submitted.

s0130.chinese: 紂師雖眾，皆無戰之心，心欲武王亟入。
s0130.literal: He made the Duke of Zhou prime minister, to govern the eastern regions.

s0131.chinese: 紂師皆倒兵以戰，以開武王。
s0131.literal: In the second year, King Wu toured the eastern regions.

s0132.chinese: 武王馳之，紂兵皆崩畔紂。
s0132.literal: King Wu charged forward, the Zhou troops all collapsed and rebelled against Zhou.

s0133.chinese: 紂走，反入登于鹿臺之上，蒙衣其殊玉，自燔于火而死。
s0133.literal: Zhou fled, returned and ascended the Deer Tower, covered himself with his precious jades, and burned himself to death in the fire.

s0134.chinese: 武王持大白旗以麾諸侯，諸侯畢拜武王，武王乃揖諸侯，諸侯畢從。
s0134.literal: King Wu held the great white banner to command the lords, all the lords bowed to King Wu, King Wu then bowed to the lords, all the lords followed.

s0135.chinese: 武王至商國，商國百姓咸待於郊。
s0135.literal: King Wu arrived at the Shang state, the common people of Shang all waited in the suburbs.

s0136.chinese: 於是武王使群臣告語商百姓曰：「上天降休！」
s0136.literal: Therefore King Wu sent his ministers to announce to the Shang common people: 'Heaven has sent down good fortune!'

s0137.chinese: 商人皆再拜稽首，武王亦答拜。
s0137.literal: The Shang people all bowed twice with heads to ground, King Wu also returned the bow.

s0138.literal: King Wu entered the palace, sat on the great throne, the lords all presented their captives.

s0139.chinese: 武王自射之，三發而後下車，以輕劍擊之，以黃鉞斬紂頭，縣大白之旗。
s0139.literal: King Wu made the proclamation to the four directions: 'The ancients had a saying: 'Do not kill those who surrender.'

s0140.chinese: 已而至紂之嬖妾二女，二女皆經自殺。
s0140.literal: I am not an executioner, do not kill the captives.'

s0141.chinese: 武王又射三發，擊以劍，斬以玄鉞，縣其頭小白之旗。
s0141.literal: King Wu released the imprisoned Jizi, restored the imprisoned Bi Gan.

s0142.literal: He searched for the imprisoned Xiahou Shang, found him and released him.

s0143.chinese: 其明日，除道，修社及商紂宮。
s0143.literal: He made the Duke of Zhou guard the eastern regions.

s0144.chinese: 及期，百夫荷罕旗以先驅。
s0144.literal: In the twelfth year, King Wu died.

s0145.chinese: 武王弟叔振鐸奉陳常車，周公旦把大鉞，畢公把小鉞，以夾武王。
s0145.literal: King Cheng was young, the Duke of Zhou acted as regent.

s0146.chinese: 散宜生、太顛、閎夭皆執劍以衛武王。
s0146.literal: The three guards rebelled, saying: 'The Duke of Zhou will harm the young king.'

s0147.chinese: 既入，立于社南大卒之左，［左］右畢從。
s0147.literal: The Duke of Zhou went to the eastern capital, put down the rebellion.

s0148.chinese: 毛叔鄭奉明水，衛康叔封布茲，召公奭贊采，師尚父牽牲。
s0148.literal: He moved the Yin people to Luo, established the eastern capital.

s0149.chinese: 尹佚筴祝曰：「殷之末孫季紂，殄廢先王明德，侮蔑神祇不祀，昏暴商邑百姓，其章顯聞于天皇上帝。」
s0149.literal: He made the Da Gao proclamation, comforted the Yin people.

s0150.chinese: 於是武王再拜稽首，曰：「膺更大命，革殷，受天明命。」
s0150.literal: He made the Kang Gao proclamation, established the ritual system.

s0151.literal: He made the Jun Shi proclamation, divided the lands.

s0152.chinese: 封商紂子祿父殷之餘民。
s0152.literal: He made the Luo Gong proclamation, established the well-field system.

s0153.chinese: 武王為殷初定未集，乃使其弟管叔鮮、蔡叔度相祿父治殷。
s0153.literal: He made the wine prohibition proclamation, banned drunkenness.

s0154.chinese: 已而命召公釋箕子之囚。
s0154.literal: King Cheng grew up, the Duke of Zhou returned the government.

s0155.chinese: 命畢公釋百姓之囚，表商容之閭。
s0155.literal: King Cheng was diligent in government, the world was at peace.

s0156.chinese: 命南宮括散鹿臺之財，發鉅橋之粟，以振貧弱萌隸。
s0156.literal: King Cheng died, King Kang ascended.

s0157.chinese: 命南宮括、史佚展九鼎保玉。
s0157.literal: King Kang monitored the eastern regions, toured the lords, administered justice.

s0158.literal: Forty years without punishment, the world was at peace under King Kang.

s0159.literal: King Kang died, King Zhao ascended.

s0160.literal: King Zhao went south to tour, died at the Han River.

s0162.chinese: 封諸侯，班賜宗彝，作分殷之器物。
s0162.literal: King Mu was ambitious and fond of grandeur, personally drove the eight horses.

s0163.chinese: 武王追思先聖王，乃褒封神農之後於焦，黃帝之後於祝，帝堯之後於薊，帝舜之後於陳，大禹之後於杞。
s0163.literal: He went west to attack the Quanrong, obtained four white wolves and four white deer.

s0164.chinese: 於是封功臣謀士，而師尚父為首封。
s0164.literal: He made Zhao Ju the Grand Master, prepared to attack the Quanrong.

s0165.literal: The Quanrong submitted, King Mu stopped.

s0166.chinese: 封弟周公旦於曲阜，曰魯。
s0166.literal: He toured the north, reached the Great Wall.
